title: (Becoming a Prophetic Church) 1. The Necessity of the Cross
description: The messages by Art Katz under the general heading â€Becoming a Prophetic Churchâ€ is a compact an almost overwhelming introduction to Mr. Katzâ€™ thinking and to the word spoken as a prophetic event. A bringing in of the factor which makes Christianity real.

title: Reality Through The Cross
description: This message was delivered on 07/25/1967 at the Atlantic States Christian Convocation (Wabanna) 1967.

title: The All Inclusiveness Of The Cross
description: This message was delivered on 07/26/1967 at Atlantic States Christian Convocation (Wabanna) 1967.

title: The Cross And Emancipation From Circumscribed Horizons
description: This message was delivered on 07/30/1967 at the Atlantic States Christian Convocation (Wabanna) 1967.

title: The Cross And The Dynamic Of Victory
description: This message was delivered on 07/30/1967 at the Atlantic States Christian Convocation (Wabanna) 1967. The way of victory is the way of the cross. We are to have the same mind and disposition of the Lord Jesus. The Lord Jesus had the capacity or mind to let go. This was the opposite of Satan whose character was one of possessiveness and unlawful ambition. The Lord Jesus emptied Himself and through His cross destroyed the work of the devil. To have the mind of Christ means that we know how to let go of even our own rights. This is the principle of the cross. The climax of the risen life is the cross. The way of victory is through seeing the Lord Jesus, who is greater than all. There is gain out of loss and life out of death.

title: The Cross And The Ministry Of The Unveiled Face
description: This message was delivered on 07/28/1967 at the Atlantic States Christian Convocation (Wabanna) 1967.

title: The Cross And The Two Humanities
description: This message was delivered on 07/27/1967 at the Atlantic States Christian Convocation (Wabanna) 1967.

title: The Cross in Communion
description: Speaking from Mark 9, Art gives a prophetic setting for the Last Days whereby the believer is encouraged to a place of true and continuing devotion for God’s sake in order to be that final witness to Israel in their extremity.

title: The Cross in Gethsemane
description: Art probes the meaning of Gethsemane for the Church, noting that the first drops of blood were voluntarily given by Jesus at Gethsemane before they were extracted from Him by man at the Cross.

title: The Cross in Isaiah 53
description: The task of rightly interpreting this key text is crucial for the Church in its witness to Israel – especially in the Last Days.

title: The Cross in Psalm 51
description: King David leaves for us a statement of the most profound repentance ever expressed in Scripture.
